strings.Value: "I'd like to see your goods."
"Do you know anything about the ancient dwarven fortress in these lands?"
"Tell me about yourself."
"You look a little unusual for a dwarf."
"I have to go. So long!"
"What are you reading?"
"Have you heard about the thefts plaguing in the city?"
"Tell me, do you have any books by Willas Gunderson?"
"Can I borrow these books?"
"Does the phrase 'fifth in ten' mean anything to you?"
"From a practical standpoint, you're probably right..."
"Heh. Kinsman, whatever the explanation, a dwarf without a beard is a sad sight!"
"Right! Out with old traditions!"

{n}A young dwarf, red-haired, neat and surprisingly clean-shaven, stands leaning against a sledge-hammer. He's busy reading some book, but as you approach he looks up and bows slightly.{/n} "Greetings, Your Grace! I am Verdel, a blacksmith. What can I do to help you?"
{n}As usual, Verdel is taking a break from his labors in the blacksmith shop, reading a book. When he notices you, he stops reading and bows.{/n}

"Nothing at all, Your {mf|Grace|Grace|Highness|Highness}. Three dwarf clans used to live in these lands — the Woradash, the Langebukk and the Skjegge. My family is Skjegge. But we moved off to {g|Mivon}Mivon{/g} two hundred years ago, together with Aldori — fleeing from the Conqueror. Our grandfathers made a safe bet that the {g|Swordlords}Swordlords{/g} would need swords! Anyhow, neither me nor even my father have ever been to the old fortresses. I vaguely remember from grandfather's stories that the Langebukk stronghold was supposed to be somewhere nearby. But no, I'd have no idea where to look for it."
"As Your {mf|Grace|Grace|Highness|Highness} wishes!"

{n}Verdel sighs and runs his fingers through his hair.{/n} "You expect to see a beard, eh? No offense, but what's the point of a beard? Especially when you're a blacksmith and working with fire. You burn it once, dip it into lighting oil and catch a spark from the forge, and your beard is history! You're better off without one."

"What is there to tell, Your {mf|Grace|Grace|Highness|Highness}? I'm a blacksmith. My father was a blacksmith. My grandfather was a blacksmith, and his grandfather too. Besides, every one of them were remarkably fertile, so I have plenty of cousins, second cousins, third cousins, and all of them are blacksmiths too. Pretty much all the weapons in {g|Mivon}Mivon{/g} were forged by someone from our family. That's why I moved away from the old home grounds. My skills are more useful here, that's for sure."
"All the best, Your {mf|Grace|Grace|Highness|Highness}!"

{n}Verdel looks a little confused.{/n} "Well, different things... It's nice to take a rest with a good book. Just now it's 'Valour and Honor: Ten Adventures of the Splendid Willas Gunderson in {g|Absalom}Absalom{/g}'."
{n}Verdel frowns.{/n} "Heard? Your Highness, I myself am the victim of those thieves! Stole my tools — right from under my very nose!"
"I was in the back yard, getting coal for the furnace, and I heard some noise inside. I ran in — and the thief jumped right into a magic portal and vanished! I didn't even get a good look."
"It's like you're interrogating me! Uh, of course I do. Everyone says he's bad, but I like him. The guy writes with feeling... I mean, used to write."
"Of course! Read away."
"Is this about Gunderson? He has a book titled 'Ten Adventures'. It's some of his best work!"
"Well, for once in my life, I got approval from a kinsman!"
"You don't say. Why, they might start taking us for elves!" {n}Verdel chuckles, but it's clear he has no intention of changing his opinion.{/n}
"Practicality is my middle name, right!" {n}Verdel nods, content.{/n}
